description: Update the homepage to add the missing Coder primary agent card, fix inaccurate agent category counts, add a 'What's New' capability highlights section, and ensure the skill count display is dynamic and accurate.

userStories.title: Add Coder to the Human-in-the-Loop section on homepage
userStories.description: As a visitor reading the homepage, I want to see all four primary agents (Planner, Builder, Coder, Toolkit) in the human-in-the-loop section, so I understand my full set of options when working with the toolkit.
acceptanceCriteria: A fourth 'Coder' card is added to the human-in-the-loop cards grid on the homepage
The card uses a distinct color (green or teal)
The Coder card copy is concise and accurate
The card links to /concepts/the-human-in-the-loop#coder
The grid layout handles four cards cleanly
Hero text or section intro updated to include Coder
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser — confirm four cards render in both light and dark mode

userStories.title: Fix agent category counts
userStories.description: As a visitor reading the homepage's agent category stats, I want accurate counts for each category so I understand the toolkit's composition.
acceptanceCriteria: Investigate manifest: confirm backend-critic-go, backend-critic-java, backend-critic-ts are categorized as 'critics'
Fix extraction script or agent frontmatter so all *-critic-* agents are categorized as critics
Critics count on homepage accurately reflects all critic agents
Total agent count on homepage is accurate
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser — confirm category counts match actual agent counts

userStories.title: Add 'What's New' capability highlights
userStories.description: As a visitor evaluating the toolkit, I want to see a brief summary of major new capabilities so I understand how the toolkit has evolved.
acceptanceCriteria: A compact 'What's New' section or banner is added to the homepage
Section highlights Authentication System, Electron Desktop Testing, Agent Resilience, and Vectorized Search with one-liner descriptions
Each item links to the relevant docs page or section
Section has a 'View all changes →' link to /changelog
Section styled consistently with existing homepage design patterns
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser — confirm section appears in both light and dark mode

userStories.title: Update dynamic skill count display
userStories.description: As a visitor reading the homepage Skills section, I want the skill count badge and summary text to show the correct total, reflecting newly added skills.
acceptanceCriteria: The skill count shown in the homepage Skills section reflects the accurate post-update total
If count was hardcoded anywhere, replace with dynamic manifest-driven count
The 8 preview skills shown remain a reasonable representative sample
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
